DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare safety efficacy 1 % MIM-D3 5 % MIM-D3 placebo treatment sign symptom dry eye .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study MIM-D3 Ophthalmic Solution Treatment Dry Eye
DOC.criteria: 1 . Be least 18 year age 2 . Provide write informed consent 3 . Have report history dry eye 4 . Have history use desire use eye drop dry eye 1 . Be diagnose ongoing ocular infection ( bacterial , viral , fungal ) , active ocular inflammation ( e.g . follicular conjunctivitis ) Visit 1 , diagnose ocular rosacea , viral bacterial disease cornea conjunctiva , within last 12 month 2 . Have plan ocular and/or lid surgery study period 3 . Have correct visual acuity great equal +0.7 assess Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study ( ETDRS ) scale eye Visit 1 4 . Have uncontrolled systemic disease 5 . Be woman pregnant , nurse plan pregnancy 6 . Be woman childbearing potential use acceptable mean birth control ; acceptable method contraception include : hormonal oral , implantable , injectable , transdermal contraceptive ; mechanical spermicide conjunction barrier diaphragm condom ; IUD ; surgical sterilization partner . For nonsexually active female , abstinence may regard adequate method birth control ; however , subject becomes sexually active study , must agree use adequate birth control define remainder study 7 . Have know allergy and/or sensitivity test article component 8 . Have condition situation investigator feel may put subject significant risk , may confound study result , may interfere significantly subject 's participation study 9 . Be currently enrol investigational drug device study use investigational drug device within 45 day Visit 1 10 . Be unable unwilling follow instruction , include participation study assessment visit
